00019     /* What to do after row has been written */

00023 int save(void)
00024 {
00025     char *error_ptr;
00026     FILE *fh;
00027     GLubyte *image;
00028 
00029     int viewport[4]; /* x,y,width,height */
00030     
00031 
00032     glGetIntegerv(GL_VIEWPORT, viewport);
00033     fh = fopen("test.png", "wb");
00034     
00035     /* Create png_struct & png_info, allocte and initalise */
00036     png_structp  png_ptr = png_create_write_struct
00037         (PNG_LIBPNG_VER_STRING, (png_voidp)error_ptr, NULL, NULL);
00038 
00039     png_infop info_ptr = png_create_info_struct(png_ptr);
00040 
00041     /* Set up error handling */
00042     if ( setjmp(png_jmpbuf(png_ptr)) ) {
00043         png_destroy_write_struct(&png_ptr, &info_ptr);
00044         fclose(fh);
00045     }
00046             
00047     /* Set up output */
00048     png_init_io(png_ptr, fh);
00049 
00050     /* Callback function */
00051     png_set_write_status_fn(png_ptr, write_row_callback);
00052     
00053     /* Get current viewport */
00054     glGetIntegerv(GL_VIEWPORT, viewport);
00055 
00056     /* Allocate memory for image */
00057     image = (GLubyte *) malloc(viewport[2] * viewport[3] * sizeof(GLubyte) * 3);
00058 
00059     /* OpenGL's default to 4 byte pack alignment so each row always has 0 (mod 4)
00060      * bytes. We don't want this (i'm led to believe) */
00061     glPixelStorei(GL_PACK_ALIGNMENT, 1);
00062 
00063     glReadPixels(viewport[0], viewport[1], viewport[2], viewport[3], GL_RGB, 
00064             GL_UNSIGNED_BYTE, image);
00065     
00066     png_write_image(png_ptr, image);
00067 
00068     fclose(fh);
00069 
00070     return 0;
00071 }
